thread.title: Carrie Underwood Shares Video Of Her Pup Undergoing Hydrotherapy After Paralysis
thread.title_full: Carrie Underwood Shares Video Of Her Pup Undergoing Hydrotherapy After Paralysis

author: Krystle Vermes
title: Carrie Underwood Shares Video Of Her Pup Undergoing Hydrotherapy After Paralysis
text:
Carrie Underwood Shares Video Of Her Pup Undergoing Hydrotherapy After Paralysis "... a long way to go ..." by Krystle Vermes January 6, 2017 at 10:38am Advertisement - story continues below 
Country singer Carrie Underwood has revealed that her dog, Ace, isÂ undergoing hydrotherapy after being completely paralyzed. 
In an Instagram video posting Jan. 4, Underwood said the rat terrier suffered a herniated disk right before Christmas. As a result, he became paralyzed in his back end. 
After resting for a couple of days, he was able to recover mobility in his right side, she said. His left side is slowing getting better through the treatment, the singer said, but Ace still has a long way to go. Advertisement - story continues below Van Susteren Outfoxes Fox After Network Co-opts Her Webpage 
âHe’s taking his physical therapy like a champ!” she wrote on Instagram. A video posted by Carrie Underwood (@carrieunderwood) on Jan 3, 2017 at 6:16pm PST 
Underwood, 33, and her 36-year-old husband, NHL player Mike Fisher, have two dogs at home with their 2-year-old son, Isaiah. Advertisement - story continues below 
This is not the first time the singer has posted on social media about one of her pets. On Sept. 2, Underwood used Instagram to upload a video of her other pup, Penny Jean. 
âGot up from the breakfast table to change a diaper and this is what happens!â she wrote as a caption. âNaughty Penny!â 
Off-camera, Underwood could be heard talking to the dog. A video posted by Carrie Underwood (@carrieunderwood) on Sep 2, 2016 at 7:51am PDT Advertisement - story continues below
